other_tests.findings: The appendix is dilated to 10 mm and demonstrates a thickened, hyperenhancing wall with adjacent fat stranding, consistent with acute appendicitis. A 1-2 mm subpleural pulmonary nodule in the right middle lobe, which has been stable since an unspecified date.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The pulmonary nodule has been stable since the last assessment.
